Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to the E-6 Mercury aircraft to improve mission capability and readiness.  All sixteen (16) aircraft, unless otherwise noted, in the E-6 fleet will receive each modification.  The E-6 is a manned airborne communications platform designed to provide a survivable, endurable, and reliable airborne Command and Control Communications capability in support of the President, Secretary of Defense, and United States strategic and non-strategic forces.  

-Safety Deficiencies (OSIP 008-02) corrects high risk aircraft safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  

-Tech Insertion (OSIP 003-04) corrects aircraft obsolescence, supportability, weight management and interoperability deficiencies through new technology insertion enabling mission readiness and mandate compliance. 

-Service Life Extension Program (OSIP 003-07) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2038+ through airframe strengthening and structural data recording and analysis.  

-Communications Upgrade (OSIP 012-07) installs expanded aircraft digital communication paths and processing to improve airborne command post operations and modernizes direct over-the-horizon communications links to deployed strategic forces.  

-Block I (OSIP 008-10) corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence. 

-Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (OSIP 013-10) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's National Command and Control Architecture.  

-Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) (OSIP 002-12) corrects airborne command post operational test deficiencies by installing an improved APU to meet increased aircraft power requirements.  

-Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) (OSIP 014-14) replaces obsolete Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals with improved FAB-T and replaces Secure Emergency Conferencing Network with PNVC.  

-Mission Systems (OSIP 014-21) addresses obsolescence and supportability upgrades through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) systems.

Justification.val:
The FY 2021 funding request was increased by $43.633 million due to: 

Increase in number of scheduled installations for Safety Deficiencies (OSIP 008-02) for Kapton Lower Lobe, Tech Insertion (OSIP 003-04) for Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade (FTSU), Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) (OSIP 003-07) for SLEP Phase 1B, Communications Upgrade (OSIP 012-07) for Key Generator Receiver (KGR-72) , Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (OSIP 013-10) MR-TCDL system,  Auxiliary Power Unit (OSIP 002-12) APU system, Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential National Voice Conferencing and Digital Red Switch System (FAB-T/PNVC/DRSS) (OSIP 014-14) for FAB-T, PNVC and DRSS systems.

Increase in procurements of kits for the following: FTSU, Global Positioning System M Code Advanced Digital Antenna Production, MR-TCDL, FAB-T and PNVC.

Increase in Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) for Mission Computer Modernization (MCM) and Secondary Launch Platform Airborne (SLP-A).

Note: Correct Cost To Complete is $81.910 million.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: The Operational Safety Improvement Program corrects safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness. The OSIP also addresses Federal agency directives, aging aircraft material condition, and emergent safety hazards generated by the operational environment. Modifications include, but not limited to: Fuel Quantity Indicator System (FQIS) modification, Kapton wiring replacement and other safety deficiencies that require correction.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: FQIS kit buys PY-FY21; installations in PY-FY22. Aircraft Kapton NRE PY to beyond FYDP, buys kits and installs in PY to beyond FYDP. Kapton Lower Lobe, Wings, Engine Struts, and Tail are included in Kapton replacement efforts.

FY20 Support Equipment funding is for procurement of GPS ADAP Test Bench and Control Display Navigation Unit items. FY24-FY25 Support Equipment funding is for Phase 2 AC Electrical items.

FY21 Other Support increase in funding is required for project management and acquisition support of initial installation ramp-up of Global Positioning System/Advanced Digital Antenna Production (GPS/ADAP) and Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade (FTSU) programs. FY22 Other Support increase project management and acquisition support in support of AC Electrical Phase 2.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Technology Insertion corrects aircraft systems obsolescence, supportability, and interoperability deficiencies as well as providing weight savings initiatives through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) system integration onto the E-6B. Integration of already qualified airborne systems will be primary solution sets, but if required the ruggedization of the COTs/GOTs from land or water fielded systems may be pursued. Carbon Brakes integrates prior DoD-135/707 type brakes to the E-6B. Seats integrates DoD approved mission seats to meet E-6B crash load requirements. ADS-B Out integrates production COTs/GOTs to address Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) civil navigation requirements by calendar year 2020. Global Positioning System (GPS) M Code/Advanced Digital Antenna Production (ADAP) integrates production GOTs systems to correct aircraft GPS deficiencies and improve readiness. Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade (FTSU) utilizes new commercially proven processes and materials to correct fuel system leaks caused by age and operational hours. AC Electrical Phase 1 will integrate production COTs/GOTs equipment to correct power generation deficiencies and increase readiness; Phase 2 will integrate COTs/GOTs equipment to correct electrical distribution, quality, and cooling deficiencies.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: Carbon Brake installs in PY-FY23 based on fleet aircraft availability. Seats and ADS-B Out installs in PY-FY20 based on fleet aircraft availability. FTSU A-kit buys and installs in FY19-FY23. GPS ADAP A-kit and B-kit buys in FY20-FY24 with installs in FY21-FY25. Aircraft Electrical Phase 1 NRE and 16 kit buys in FY20 with organic installs; Phase 2 NRE FY22-FY24, A-kit and B-kit buys in FY24 to beyond FYDP, and installs in FY25 to beyond FYDP.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2038+ through airframe strengthening, structural data recording and analysis, and just in time modifications to prevent aircraft grounding due to fatigue.  Modifications include, but not limited to:  SLEP Phase 1; Individual Aircraft Tracking System (IATS); Runway Survey Analysis; and SLEP Phase 1B.  IATS will integrate the data collected from already installed Digital Flight Data Acquisition Unit (DFDAU) to support the Aircraft Structural Integrity Program along with data collected from a representative sample of E-6Bs (2 aircraft) during a limited period of time.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: FY19-FY21 NRE is for SLEP Phase 1B. SLEP Phase 1B kit buys PY to beyond FYDP and installs FY19 to beyond FYDP.

Name.@footnote: FY21 Data is the final evaluated data, ensuring delivered data meets Government requirements and approved corrections made to delivered data and incorporation into Electronic Technical Manuals (ETMs) and NATOPS (aircrew).

FY21 Other support costs includes project management, acquisition and engineering support to execute the contract for the High Power Transmit Set (HPTS) and Key Generator Receiver (KGR-72) programs.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Installs expanded aircraft digital communication paths and processing to improve airborne command post operations and modernizes direct over-the-horizon communications links to deployed strategic forces.  Internet Protocol (IP) connectivity and wideband communication capability to enable voice, video and data services is mission critical to command and control operations.  Modifications include: IP Phase 1, International Marine/Maritime Satellite (INMARSAT); IP Phase 3, removal of Utility Trailing Wire Antenna (UTWA); Key Generator Receiver (KGR)-72; and High Power Transmit Set (HPTS) Modernization Program.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  KGR-72 NRE in FY17-FY19. KGR-72 production B kit Life of Type Buy in FY19, A kit buy in FY19 and production installs in FY20-FY21. HPTS Modernization NRE begins in FY19-FY22 with procurement of kits FY22-FY25 and production installs in FY23-FYDP.

FY19 is the final year of Block I funding.  Remaining Block I efforts necessary to complete production installation thru FY20 will be funded with FY19 funding.

Technology Upgrade Block I A kits quantity of 16 consists of 2 Prior year validation/verification kits, 10 retrofits and 4 forward fits.  Technology Upgrade Block I B kits were procured by the U.S. Air Force.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Block I corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence. Modifications include, but not limited to: Block I; Very Low Frequency (VLF) Transmit Terminal (VTT); and Technology Upgrade including Block I, and Workstations.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Block I Systems Integration Lab (SIL) & aircraft (A/C) development kit installed in SIL FY06 and in A/C FY08; Milestone-C 3Q FY10; Low-Rate Initial Production (LRIP) contract award 3Q FY10; LRIP 1 kit buy in FY10 and 3 kit buys in FY11 with installs in FY11 and FY12 (4 A/C); Full-Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review achieved 2Q FY12. FRP kit buys PY-FY17 (11 A/C) with installs in PY-FY20. VTT Prototype SIL and A/C development kit delivery in FY11 with installation in FY12. SIL and A/C testing 2Q FY12 to 1Q FY13. VTT Production kit buys in PY-FY17 with installs in PY-FY20 (15 A/C).

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (MR-TCDL) is an Army program which developed production hardware that is being integrated into the E-6B aircraft. The E-6B MR-TCDL program supports expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's National Command and Control Architecture.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: E-6B MR-TCDL integration NRE PY-FY20. PY NRE includes one A & B kit and one install. MR-TCDL Production A kit buys in PY-FY22 and B Kit buys in PY-FY21, with installs PY-FYDP.

Name.@footnote: FY21-FY22 Other Support funding increase driven by installation schedule requiring increased need for contractor program management oversight of concurrent APU aircraft modification installation with MR-TCDL and FAB-T/PNVC/DRSS to minimize aircraft out of reporting time. APU kits undergo a re-preservation process at CONUS depots and Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) depot-level maintenance facility in Rzezow, Poland prior to installation that require contractor program management oversight.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) incorporates safety, capacity and life-limiting propulsion and power corrective actions to resolve safety and readiness concerns.  Corrections to design deficiencies found during post production test and evaluation and discovered during fleet operations have resulted in safety and reliability degradations that must be corrected.  The requirement to upgrade or modify the APU is critical in maintaining sustainable fleet reliability, safety, and performance and is necessary to meet established mission requirements.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  APU Kit buys PY-FY19; installations PY-FYDP based on fleet aircraft availability.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals (FAB-T) and Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (PNVC) are U.S. Air Force (USAF) programs of record. USAF will be providing production hardware to the E-6B for integration into the aircraft. These systems are an obsolescence replacement for the currently installed Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals (MILSTAR). E-6B integration NRE for FAB-T
and PNVC includes Red Switch (RS) integration, which is required for PNVC capability.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: FAB-T/PNVC/RS NRE in PY-FY19 and FY21- FY23. FAB-T A kit buys in PY-FY22; with installs in PY-FYDP. PNVC A kit buys in PY-FY22; B kit buys in FY18-FY19; with installs in PY-FYDP. RS A kit buys in PY-FY22; B kit buys in PY-FY22; with installs in PY-FYDP.

Other support costs include project management and acquisition support integral to MCM and SLP-A execution.

Name.@footnote: FY21 and FY22 NRE to support Mission Computer Modernization (MCM) and SLP-A for integration into E-6B Systems Integration Lab (SIL) and validation aircraft. FY24-FY25 NRE to support Mission Operations Monitor (MOM).

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Mission Systems addresses obsolescence and supportability upgrades through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) system integration onto the E-6B. Integration of already qualified airborne systems will be primary solution sets, but if required the ruggedization of the COTs/GOTs from land or water fielded systems will be pursued. Secondary Launch Platform - Airborne (SLP-A) will integrate an Air Force procured system onto the E-6B to replace the current ALCS which is going obsolete. Mission Computer Modernization (MCM) (previously known as 64 Bit) will address mission systems obsolescence and associated cyber vulnerabilities by re-hosting latest version of software on 64 Bit compliant hardware architecture.  Mission Operations Monitor (MOM) will update already installed E-6B systems with the ability to monitor and record critical mission parameters to ensure mission accomplishment and provide for accurate and timely post mission evaluations.

This OSIP is a new start in FY21.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: SLP-A NRE FY21-FY23, A kit buys FY22-FYDP, B kit buys FY22-FYDP, with installs in FY23-FYDP. MCM NRE FY21-FY23, A kit buys in FY22-FY24, B kit buys FY22-FY24 with installs FY23-FY25. MOM NRE FY24-FY25, MOM A & B Kits and installs beyond FYDP.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Support Only Installation
